intro: Pentaschistis meruensis, commonly known as the East African mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of trees and shrubs. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers. Its berries are usually red or orange, containing sticky seeds that adhere to birds for dispersal. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for certain bird species and contributing to nutrient cycling in forest canopies.
